;Data released by the National Bureau of Statistics on the 18th showed that preliminary calculations showed that China’s gross domestic product (GDP) in the first three quarters ) 91.3027 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 5.2% at constant prices.

;

;Looking at quarters, GDP grew by 4.5% year-on-year in the first quarter, 6.3% in the second quarter, and 4.9% in the third quarter. From a quarter-on-quarter perspective, GDP grew by 1.3% in the third quarter.

;

;Sheng Laiyun, deputy director of the National Bureau of Statistics, said at a press conference of the State Council Information Office that day that in the first three quarters, faced with the complex and severe international environment and the arduous and arduous tasks of domestic reform, development and stability, various regions and departments Resolutely implement the decisions and arrangements of the Party Central Committee and the State Council, focus on expanding domestic demand, boost confidence, and prevent risks, and the national economy continues to recover and improve.

;

;The overall agricultural production situation is good, the recovery of industrial production is accelerating, and the service industry continues to recover rapidly. In the first three quarters, the added value of agriculture (planting industry) increased by 3.6% year-on-year; the added value of the national industrial enterprises above designated size increased by 4% year-on-year, 0.2 percentage points faster than the first half of the year; the added value of the service industry increased by 6% year-on-year.

;

;Market sales tend to be active, the scale of fixed asset investment continues to expand, and the import and export of goods are generally stable. In the first three quarters, the total retail sales of consumer goods reached 34,210.7 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 6.8%. National fixed asset investment (excluding rural households) increased by 3.1% year-on-year; excluding the impact of price factors, it increased by 6% year-on-year. The total import and export of goods was 30.8021 billion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 0.2%.

;

;Consumer prices rose moderately, the employment situation was generally stable, and residents' income grew steadily. In the first three quarters, the national consumer price index (CPI) rose by 0.4% year-on-year, and the national average urban surveyed unemployment rate was 5.3%. The per capita disposable income of residents across the country was 29,398 yuan, a nominal increase of 6.3% year-on-year; after deducting price factors, the real growth was 5.9%, 0.1 percentage point faster than the first half of the year.

;

;"Overall, the national economy has continued to recover in the first three quarters, and high-quality development has been solidly advanced, laying a solid foundation for achieving the full-year development goals. However, it must also be noted that the external environment has become more The situation is complex and severe, domestic demand is still insufficient, and the foundation for economic recovery still needs to be consolidated." Sheng Laiyun said that in the next stage, we must do a good job in implementing the policies that have been introduced to achieve effective results, and continue to promote the continued improvement of economic performance, the continuous improvement of endogenous power, and the continuous improvement of social It is expected to continue to improve, risks and hidden dangers will continue to be resolved, and efforts will be made to achieve the economic and social development goals for the year.

;On October 17, the official website of the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security announced that the State Council appoints and removes national staff. Among them, Sun Guangyu was appointed as Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council; Wang Zhiqing was removed from the post of Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council.

;

;Sun Guangyu previously served as a member of the Party Committee and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management. Wang Zhiqing, who has resigned, has served as Chairman and Party Secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group.  

;

;Since July this year, the deputy secretary-general of the State Council has been reshuffled frequently, with "four in and four out" - Sun Guangyu, Xu Shouben, Wang Zhijun, and Wang Yonghong have taken over, while Wang Zhiqing, Ding Xuedong, Peng Shujie, and Li Wenwen have stepped down.

;

;In March this year, during the two sessions of the National People’s Congress, the leadership team of the central government changed, and State Councilor Wu Zhenglong also served as Secretary-General of the State Council. According to public reports, there are currently at least 7 deputy secretaries-general of the State Council, namely Meng Yang, Liu Jianbo, Guo Wei, Wang Zhijun, Wang Yonghong, Xu Shouben, and Sun Guangyu (in order of appointment). Among them, Wang Zhijun is clearly at the ministerial level.

;

;;The four new deputy secretaries-general of the State Council come from different fields;

;

;The four new deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who took up their posts this year come from different fields. He is an expert in the field. Sun Guangyu has worked in the chemical industry for a long time and is an expert in the field of hazardous chemical safety supervision. Before taking up his new post, he served as a member of the Party Committee and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management; Xu Shouben is a "veteran" in the financial industry and before taking up his new post, he served as the vice president of the China Development Bank. ; Wang Zhijun has been engaged in economic management work in central ministries and commissions for a long time, and served as deputy secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Party Committee before taking office; Wang Yonghong has long worked in the State Administration Bureau (referred to as the State Administration Bureau), serving for 32 years, and took office in June this year. Secretary of the Party Leadership Group and Director of the Management Bureau.

;

;The four new people are all born after 1965, among whom Wang Yonghong and Xu Shouben were both born in 1969.

;

;;;

;Sun Guangyu. Data map

;

;Sun Guangyu, who took office as Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council today, was born in December 1966. He has a university degree, a master's degree in engineering, a professor-level senior engineer, and a member of the chemical industry group of the National Safety Production Expert Group.

;

;Sun Guangyu graduated from Dalian University of Technology, majoring in fine chemical engineering. According to the official website of Dalian University of Technology, he worked at Sinopec in his early years. In 2009, he was transferred from the manager of the Aromatic Hydrocarbons Department of the Tianjin Branch of Sinopec Co., Ltd. to the deputy director and director of the Safety Supervision and Management Department of the State Administration of Work Safety, and later served as the Hazardous Chemicals Department of the Emergency Management Department. Director of the Supervision Department and Director of the First Department of Hazardous Chemical Supervision. In June 2022, Sun Guangyu served as a member of the Party Committee and Vice Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management, and later served as deputy director of the Office of the State Council Safety Committee.

;

;More than a week ago, Sun Guangyu interviewed the main person in charge of the Ordos Municipal People's Government on behalf of the Security Affairs Office of the State Council.

;

;According to the Ministry of Emergency Management, on September 7, a major high-pressure gas leak occurred at Yiding Ecological Agriculture Development Co., Ltd. in Ordos, Inner Mongolia, resulting in 10 deaths and 3 injuries in a major production safety accident. On September 14, the State Council Safety Committee decided to supervise the investigation and handling of this major accident. On September 11, the Ministry of Emergency Management organized a national emergency video conference on hazardous chemicals safety risk prevention, at which the situation of the Ordos "9.7" accident was reported. Sun Guangyu, member of the Party Committee and Vice Minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management, attended the meeting and delivered a speech. The meeting pointed out that lessons from the accident must be carefully learned, and the lessons learned in blood must not be verified with blood again!

;

;On October 8, in response to the "9.7" major high-pressure gas leakage accident in Ordos, the Office of the State Council Safety Committee interviewed the main person in charge of the Ordos Municipal People's Government. Sun Guangyu, deputy director of the Office of the State Council Security Committee and deputy minister of the Ministry of Emergency Management, presided over the interview, and heads of relevant departments and bureaus of the Ministry of Emergency Management attended the interview.

;

;Now, Sun Guangyu has left the chemical industry and emergency management leadership position he held for many years and joined the State Council.

;

;;;

;Xu Shouben. Data map

;

;Xu Shouben took office as deputy secretary-general of the State Council on August 30.

;

;Public information shows that Xu Shouben was born in April 1969 in Yantai, Shandong Province. He graduated from the School of Management of Harbin Institute of Technology and received a doctorate in Western Economics from Lingnan College of Sun Yat-sen University and is a senior economist.

;

;Xu Shouben has worked in the financial industry for many years. He joined the Guangdong Branch of ICBC in April 1995. He has worked in various branches of ICBC in Guangdong Province for a long time. He once served as the Office Director of ICBC Guangdong Branch, President of Guangdong Jiangmen Branch, and Party committee secretary and other positions. In March 2011, he was appointed as the vice president of the Guangdong Branch and in July 2015, he was appointed as the president of the Shenzhen Branch. In August 2020, Xu Shouben was promoted to Vice President of ICBC. In October 2022, Xu Shouben was appointed as Vice President of the China Development Bank and will take office as the State Council in August this year.

;

;;;

;Wang Zhijun. Data map

;

;Wang Zhijun and Wang Yonghong took up their posts on the same day and were appointed deputy secretary-general of the State Council on July 4. Among them, Wang Zhijun is in charge of the daily work of the General Office of the State Council and is clearly at the ministerial level. He is a member of the 20th Central Committee.

;

;The public resume shows that Wang Zhijun was born in September 1965 in Hohhot, Inner Mongolia, and has a graduate degree.

;

;Wang Zhijun has been responsible for economic management for many years. He has served as the director of the National Economic Comprehensive Department of the National Development and Reform Commission, deputy inspector of the Comprehensive Group of the Office of the National Energy Leading Group, and deputy director of the Economic Bureau No. 1 of the Office of the Central Financial and Economic Leading Group. , inspector, director of the fifth economic bureau, director of the first economic bureau of the Office of the Central Financial and Economic Commission, etc. In January 2019, Wang Zhijun was appointed as a member of the Party Leadership Group and Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology. In April 2022, he was transferred to the position of Deputy Secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Party Committee, and he will assume the new position of the State Council in July this year.

;

;;;

;Wang Yonghong. Data map

;

;Wang Yonghong has worked in the State Administration of Institutional Affairs for a long time. The National Administration Bureau is an agency directly under the State Council that manages the affairs of state agencies. It is responsible for the management of funds, finances, official vehicles, state-owned assets and real estate of central state agencies, and is responsible for the management of life services for party and state leaders and relevant service objects within a designated range. .

;

;According to the official website of the State Administration of Management, Wang Yonghong was born in June 1969, with a bachelor's degree and a master's degree in management. He joined the National Bureau of Management in August 1991 and served successively as deputy director of the Financial Management Department, deputy director of the Logistics Reform and Comprehensive Management Department, director of the training center, director of the Financial Management Department, and director of the Dongba Service Center of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs; 2017 In April 2017, he was appointed as deputy director, member of the Party Leadership Group and director of the Dongba Service Center of the State Administration of Management. In November 2017, he was appointed as deputy director and member of the leading party group of the State Administration of Management.

;

;On June 20 this year, relevant responsible comrades from the Organization Department of the Central Committee attended the meeting of leading cadres of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs and announced the central government’s decision: Comrade Wang Yonghong was appointed as Party Secretary and Director of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs.

;

;Wang Yonghong has assumed the new post of Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council and concurrently serves as Party Secretary and Director of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs. Previous directors of the State Administration of Management were also concurrently held by the deputy secretary-general of the State Council.

;

;;Of the four deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who have resigned, three have assumed new duties;

;

;Of the four deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who have resigned this year, three have assumed their new posts. new.

;

;Wang Zhiqing, who resigned as deputy secretary-general of the State Council today, has been appointed chairman and party secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd. a week ago. Among the three deputy secretaries-general of the State Council who resigned on July 4, Ding Xuedong has served as Party Secretary of the National Council for Social Security Fund, and Li Wenwen has served as Deputy Minister of the Central Ministry of Social Work and Director of the Office of the Central Joint Conference on Petitions, and continues to serve concurrently as the National Petitions Bureau. Director of the Bureau and Secretary of the Party Leadership Group.

;

;;;

;Wang Zhiqing. Data map

;

;The public resume shows that Wang Zhiqing was born in March 1966 and is from Tianjin. Wang Zhiqing has worked in the civil aviation system for a long time. He joined the Civil Aviation Administration of China in 1992 and held leadership positions in multiple departments. In March 2014, he was appointed deputy director of the Civil Aviation Administration of China. In March 2019, he was transferred to the position of member of the Party Leadership Group, Chief Planner, and Director of the Comprehensive Planning Department of the Ministry of Transport. In February 2021, he was promoted to Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Transport. In November 2021, Wang Zhiqing was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council.

;

;According to the "China Eastern Airlines" WeChat public account, on the morning of October 9, China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd. held a meeting for middle-level and above managers. Relevant responsible comrades from the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China announced the decision of the Central Committee on the appointment of Chairman and Party Secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd.: Comrade Wang Zhiqing is appointed as Chairman and Party Secretary of China Eastern Airlines Group Co., Ltd. China Eastern Airlines, headquartered in Shanghai, is one of China's three major state-owned backbone air transport groups.

;

;On July 4, the State Council appointed and removed national staff. On the same day that Wang Zhijun and Wang Yonghong assumed the new deputy secretaries-general of the State Council, Ding Xuedong, Peng Shujie, and Li Wenwen were dismissed from their posts as deputy secretaries-general of the State Council.

;

;;;

;Ding Xuedong. Data map

;

;Ding Xuedong was a member of the 20th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. He served twice as deputy secretary-general of the State Council and served as executive deputy secretary-general of the State Council before resigning.

;

;According to the public resume, Ding Xuedong, born in February 1960 in Changzhou, Jiangsu Province, is a master's student in the Industrial Economics Department of Hubei Institute of Finance and Economics (now Zhongnan University of Economics and Law), and a finance major in the Graduate Department of the Institute of Fiscal Science of the Ministry of Finance. PhD in Economics, doctoral supervisor at the Institute of Fiscal Science of the Ministry of Finance.  

;

;He has served in the Ministry of Finance for a long time, serving successively as Director of the Department of Basic Management of State-owned Capital Funds, Director of the Department of Agriculture, and Director of the Department of Education, Science and Culture. In November 2006, he served as Assistant Minister of Finance and Party Leadership Group Member, in March 2008, served as Deputy Minister of Finance.

;

;In May 2010, Ding Xuedong was appointed as Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council. In July 2013, he was appointed as Chairman and CEO of China Investment Corporation. In October 2014, he was concurrently appointed as Chairman of CICC.

;

;In March 2017, the State Council appointed Ding Xuedong as Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council (ministerial level).

;

;On July 1 this year, the National Council for Social Security Fund held a meeting of leading cadres. Relevant responsible comrades from the Organization Department of the Central Committee announced the decision of the Central Committee: Comrade Ding Xuedong will be appointed Secretary of the Party Leadership Group of the National Council for Social Security Fund.

;

;;;

;Peng Shujie. Data map

;

;Peng Shujie is a "veteran" in journalism. He was born in May 1963 in Bengbu, Anhui Province. He is a senior journalist and a master's degree candidate.

;

;According to his public resume, Peng Shujie studied in the Department of Foreign Languages ​​of Anhui University and the Department of Journalism of the Graduate School of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences in his early years. In the 1990s, he was also sent to study abroad at the University of Hawaii in the United States. He joined Xinhua News Agency in 1989 and served successively as reporter and deputy director of Xinhua News Agency’s external central news gathering and editing office, deputy director and director of the external central foreign affairs news gathering and editing office, chief editorial assistant (deputy bureau level) of Xinhua News Agency’s chief editorial office, Xinhua News Agency He serves as deputy editor-in-chief of the editorial office and director of the International Department of Xinhua News Agency. In July 2014, he was promoted to deputy editor-in-chief and party member of Xinhua News Agency. In November 2015, he was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council and retired after serving for nearly 8 years.

;

;;;

;Li Wenwen. Data map

;

;According to public resume, Li Wenwen was born in January 1963. He graduated from the Department of Political Science and Law of Ningxia University and received a postgraduate degree from the Central Party School.

;

;He worked in Ningxia for a long time in his early years and served as deputy secretary of the Yinchuan Municipal Party Committee (department level), director of the Department of Justice and Party Secretary of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region; secretary of the Shizuishan Municipal Party Committee and Guyuan Municipal Party Committee secretary of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region. In June 2012, Li Wenzhang was promoted to the Standing Committee of the Party Committee of Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region and concurrently served as Secretary of the Guyuan Municipal Party Committee. In June 2015, he was appointed as member of the Standing Committee of the Party Committee and Secretary of the Political and Legal Affairs Committee of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region. In June 2016, he was appointed as member of the Standing Committee of the Liaoning Provincial Party Committee and secretary of the Political and Legal Affairs Committee. In December 2018, he served as director of the Political Department of the Ministry of National Security, member of the Party Committee, secretary of the party committee of the agency, and deputy chief superintendent.

;

;In April 2020, Li Wenwen assumed the new post of Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council, member of the Party Leadership Group of the State Council, Secretary of the Party Leadership Group, and Director of the State Bureau of Letters and Calls. It is worth noting that the past several directors of the State Bureau of Letters and Calls were also served concurrently by the deputy secretary-general of the State Council.

;

;On July 4 this year, Li Wenwen was removed from the post of Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council. Ten days later, the information in the "Leadership Introduction" column of the National Bureau of Letters and Calls showed that Li Wenwen is currently the deputy minister of the Central Ministry of Social Work, the director of the Office of the Central Joint Conference on Letters and Calls, the director and the party secretary of the National Bureau of Letters and Calls.

;

;On March 16 this year, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council issued the "Plan for the Reform of Party and State Institutions". In terms of institutional reform of the Party Central Committee, five new "Chinese-prefixed" institutions including the Central Department of Social Work were established. Among them, the Central Ministry of Social Work is responsible for coordinating and guiding the people's petition work, guiding the collection of people's suggestions, coordinating and promoting party building to lead grassroots governance and grassroots political power building, unified leadership of the party work of national industry associations and chambers of commerce, and coordinating and promoting the deepening reform and transformation of industry associations and chambers of commerce. Development, guiding the party building work of mixed-ownership enterprises, non-public enterprises, new economic organizations, new social organizations, and new employment groups, and guiding the construction of social work talent teams, etc., as a functional department of the Party Central Committee.

;

;The "Plan" also clarifies that the Central Ministry of Social Work will unifiedly lead the National Bureau of Letters and Calls. The National Bureau of Letters and Calls, a national bureau managed by the General Office of the State Council, was restructured into an agency directly under the State Council.

;

;;What are the responsibilities of the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council? ;

;

;According to public reports, there are currently at least 7 deputy secretaries-general of the State Council, namely Meng Yang, Liu Jianbo, Guo Wei, Wang Zhijun, Wang Yonghong, Xu Shouben, and Sun Guangyu (in order of appointment). In addition to the four people who took up their new posts this year, the remaining three people: Meng Yang was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council in May 2015, Liu Jianbo was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council in May 2021, and Guo Wei was appointed Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council in July 2021.

;

;How many people are generally allocated to the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council? According to the Chinese Government website, the State Council issued a "Regulations on the Main Responsibilities, Internal Organizations and Staffing of the General Office of the State Council" in July 2008, which mentioned that the administrative establishment of the General Office of the State Council is 519. Among them: 1 Secretary-General of the State Council, 9 Deputy Secretary-Generals of the State Council (including part-time ones), and 43 department-level leadership positions.

;

;What are the responsibilities of the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council?

;

;The "Working Rules of the State Council" revised in March this year clearly mentioned that the State Council implements the prime minister's responsibility system. Under the leadership of the Prime Minister, the Secretary-General is responsible for handling the daily work of the State Council, and the Deputy Secretary-General assists the Secretary-General in his work.

;

;It mentioned that “the General Office of the State Council must carefully review and review the official documents submitted by various regions and departments to the State Council for review and approval. It involves the issuance of administrative normative documents in the name of the State Council or the General Office of the State Council, If administrative normative documents are issued in the name of a department after being submitted to the State Council for approval, the judicial administrative department of the State Council shall conduct a legality review. For matters that have disagreements between departments, the leading comrades of the State Council in charge of the sponsoring department shall take the lead in strengthening coordination. The Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council shall assist The leading comrades in charge of the State Council shall do a good job in coordination.”

;

;In addition to the review and review of relevant rules and documents, more specific information can be obtained from some of the concurrent positions held by the Deputy Secretary-General of the State Council. For example, Meng Yang is concurrently the deputy director of the State Council's Working Committee on Disabled Persons, the deputy leader of the State Council's First National Comprehensive Natural Disaster Risk Survey Leading Group, and the deputy convener of the State Council's inter-ministerial joint conference system for optimizing family planning policies. Liu Jianbo concurrently serves as deputy director of the National Narcotics Control Commission. Wang Yonghong concurrently serves as Party Secretary and Director of the State Administration of Institutional Affairs. In addition, Guo Wei is also a member of the 14th National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and a member of the Agriculture and Rural Affairs Committee. Liu Jianbo is a member of the 14th National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference and a member of the Ethnic and Religious Affairs Committee.

;

;Liang Qichao is our "familiar stranger". In China, almost no one knows his name, but his vague image is limited to a reformist politician, the author of "Young China", and a father who raised many outstanding children.

;

;Liang Qichao was born in Chakeng Village, Xinhui County, Guangzhou Prefecture in 1873. In "Autobiography at Thirty", Liang Qichao used major events in Chinese and world history to find coordinates for the year of his birth: it was the tenth year after the fall of the Taiping Rebellion, one year after Zeng Guofan's death, and the third year after the Franco-Prussian War ended. Of course, when he was born, the chronology was the twelfth year of Tongzhi, Guiyou. The AD calendar was not widely adopted until the founding of New China. It was through Liang Qichao that the sayings of the 19th and 20th centuries spread in the Chinese-speaking world.

;

;Liang Qichao was one of the first Chinese to realize the turn of the century. At the beginning of 1900, he wrote "The Song of the Pacific in the Twentieth Century", predicting that the new century would usher in the Pacific Age. Chinese people in the 19th century did not realize that they were in the 19th century. Only in the 20th century will we look back with the help of new historical coordinates to describe this era of sinking, humiliation and endeavor, and salvation.

;

;In 1898, after the failure of the Hundred Days Reform, Liang Qichao went into exile in Japan and traveled around the world. After the founding of the Republic of China, Liang Qichao returned to China, and the main stages of his activities were in the ice drinking rooms in the capital Beijing and Tianjin. For him, his hometown in Guangdong has become as far away as his boyhood. But this does not mean that he bid farewell to his hometown. In fact, many of Liang Qichao's activities in Yokohama, Japan, North America and Australia relied on the huge support of the overseas Chinese network in Guangdong.

;

;;

;

;Liang Qichao during his time in Japan. ;(data map/picture);

;

;"If we focus on those people who have no names in history, we will find that from ten Since the middle of the ninth century, a large number of Cantonese have gone to North America and Japan. The use of steamships has enabled Cantonese expatriates to no longer just go to Southeast Asia, but to travel across the Pacific to all parts of the world." "Regional Culture and National Identity: Late Professor Cheng Meibao, author of "The Formation of Guangdong Cultural Concepts since the Qing Dynasty," told Southern Weekend reporters, "There are traces of Cantonese in every port on the Pacific coast. They have established guilds, temples, hometown associations in foreign countries, or organized themselves in the form of companies. , so when Kang Liang, Sun Yat-sen and others were active overseas, someone would contact them and arrange accommodation and itinerary. Behind the activities of these historical celebrities are decades of preparation by unknown groups."

; < p>;Many people have tried to write a biography of Liang Qichao. The historian Wu Qichang of the Republic of China wrote half of it until the Reform Movement of 1898; Xie Xizhang's "Biography of Liang Qichao" is divided into chapters based on Liang's interactions and relationships with different historical figures; the writer Wei Wei Before publishing the novel "In the Misty Clouds", she spent several years writing a biography of Liang Qichao. When she had written more than 100,000 words, she felt that the thread was too complicated, so she put it down and started writing novels first.

;

;2023 is the 150th anniversary of the birth of Liang Qichao, and the second part of Xu Zhiyuan's "Liang Qichao" has also been published. The first part is titled "Young Revolutionary", about Liang Qichao from 1873 to 1898, and was published in 2019. Liang Qichao may also feel this part, but he has his own urgency. Weber saw something longer-term and saw the side of modernity as an iron cage. He was a greater thinker.

;

;Of course I think thinkers can only bear the responsibility of thinkers. The formation of an ideological concept in history and its influence on us not only come from the thinkers themselves, but also come from the shaping of subsequent social and educational systems.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Liang Qichao wandered between traditional Chinese culture and Western knowledge. Most of his descendants are experts in archaeology, aerospace and other fields. But today, our dilemma is that the disciplines are too specialized and territorial, and there is an increasing lack of comprehensive humanities intellectuals like Liang Qichao. ;

;

;;Xu Zhiyuan: ;;With the subdivision of disciplines, vertical and horizontal thinkers are scarce not only in China but also around the world. Maybe when the times undergo new and huge changes, everyone is eager for the emergence of comprehensive thinkers. For example, why do so many people around the world want to read Harari's work? It is not very great or profound, but it has a certain comprehensiveness. He has put forward some kind of response to the pressing issues at hand. This response It will attract a lot of attention. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In public perception, Liang Qichao is a popular figure. A highly narrow-minded person, this year marks the 150th anniversary of his birth, and the biography of Liang Qichao is certainly an important effort to change the public's understanding of him. Among his numerous writings, which do you think are the most worthy of reading by today’s readers? ;

;

;;Xu Zhiyuan:;;Liang Qichao wrote 14 million words, which is very complicated. His experience is as important as his works. His intellectual history works, including three hundred years of scholarship in the Qing Dynasty, as well as essays such as "Young China Theory" and "New People Theory", are worthy of constant re-reading. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Compared with Liang Qichao, the public’s appreciation of Lu Xun’s works Reading is much more comprehensive. ;

;

;;Xu Zhiyuan: ;;The 20th century is a revolutionary century, and Lu Xun is remembered as a revolutionary writer. Liang Qichao has long been considered a representative of the forces of reform, which was suppressed by the revolutionary narrative. In fact, in Liang Qichao's era, he was a national writer. From people older than him to his contemporaries, to the next generation of Chen Duxiu, Mao Zedong, and Hu Shi, everyone was reading him. In addition, Liang Qichao's writing is still in the process of stylistic transformation, while Lu Xun and others have already explored a new way of writing in vernacular. In fact, it is not only Liang Qichao who has been narrowed down, but our understanding of Cai Yuanpei and Lin Yutang is far from enough, so I think more writers should join in the work of re-evaluating and rediscovering them. ;

;

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 12:25:04 +0800 叶刘淑仪：“丝绸之路也是全球的品牌”http://www.infzm.com/contents/258784
;;2023-10-18 11:00:00;
;

;;

;

;Yip Liu Shuyi, who wears many hats, is still making waves in the political arena. ;(Yao Yijiang/Photo);

;

;Before accepting the exclusive interview with Southern Weekend, Ip Liu Shuyi handed over four business cards with the titles of "Member of the Legislative Council" "Chairman of the New Democratic Party", "Convener of the Unofficial Members of the Hong Kong Executive Council" and "Co-Chairman of the Maritime Silk Road Association".

;

;These identities occupy most of her time.

;

;作为立法会议员，叶刘淑仪在在议会上质询官员时，官员称都要“打起十二分精神”。因为官员面对的，是一位曾经在政府体制中摸爬滚打了几十年的前高官，对香港情况了如指掌。作为香港新民党主席，叶刘淑仪曾称要推动香港发展优质民主，竭力为香港市民服务。繁忙的事务、频繁的曝光率，身兼数职的叶刘淑仪，仍然在政坛上，书写风云。

;

;不过，对这位香港特区首位出掌纪律部门的女性，人们评价褒贬不一。支持她的人认为，她担任香港保安局局长期间，在《公安条例》争议、居港权问题、入境事务大楼纵火案等多起事件中处事果断、作风硬朗和建树良多，是不可多得的“香港铁娘子”。但也正是这种硬朗作风，引来不少反对的声音。

;

;她还曾在2012年和2016年两次宣布参选香港特首。虽然都以惜败告终，但参选口号“赢返香港”依然让不少港人为之振奋。参选过程中，叶刘淑仪一再强调“如果当选，将率先处理香港核心管治问题”。

;

;她如何看待香港在海上丝绸之路上的独特作用，对香港的发展又有怎样的期待？

;

;;串起;;全球;;“朋友圈”;

;

;;南方周末：;;香港作为海上丝绸之路联盟城市之一，具有地理优势。香港该如何利用海上丝绸之路促进香港经济的发展，串起“朋友圈”？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;我创办的海上丝绸之路协会是在2015 年成立的，是共建“一带一路”倡议提出后最早回应倡议的香港组织。丝绸之路是中国很重要的品牌，也是个全球的品牌。 ;

;

;其实中国是最早推动全球化，对外开放的。张骞通西域是一次伟大的远征，搭建起了连接世界的桥梁。香港的地理位置在南方，也是海上丝绸之路一个非常重要的节点。历史上，自中国出海的中国商船，或回航的蕃舶，多会待冬季东北风发之便，经香港屯门出海，南驶中南半岛及南洋群岛，再到印度及波斯湾等地。

;

;丝绸之路就是一个非常重要的文化符号，应该多利用软力量向年轻人推广。比如我们安排免费的电影如《大唐玄奘》给观众欣赏，讲述商人把中国的蚕桑带到西域，也把西域一些葡萄产品带到中国这种交流的历史。利用这种软力量，帮助香港年轻人理解中国伟大的发展历史，以及深厚的文化底蕴。

;

;香港社会还有一个特色，就是很多华侨，包括很多东南亚的大家族在香港都有分支。香港跟东南亚的关系非常好。比如菲律宾大部分是福建人，新加坡有福建、潮州客家人，泰国也是很多潮州人，商业的来往非常频密。

;

;所以我觉得我们应该成立一个协会、联盟，连结海丝会沿岸的省市以及东南亚的国家。创办的时候，希望能在人心相通方面多做工夫，也希望能够教育香港年轻人多理解中国伟大的历史文化。所以协会部分重要的活动，都会安排一些年轻的大学生去海丝地区的国家走走。

;

;;南方周末：;;这就是“张骞计划”吗？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;对，学习当年张骞勇敢的开创精神。我们成立的时候，荷兰商会的会长很感兴趣，“一带一路”的终点是欧洲的鹿特丹，所以他也有兴趣加入。我们还安排了大学生到内地的广西、广东，以及东南亚的国家，如泰国、马来西亚、新加坡。另外还去了东非吉布提、欧洲伦敦。 ;

;

;值得一提的是，应希腊一个小岛的邀请，我们安排了负责中国文化的老师暑期到希腊宣传中国文化，教中文，也很受欢迎。但是疫情原因，停滞了三年，今年我们又重新启动，也得到很多企业的支持。

;

;;南方周末：;;这个计划最高的时候派了一百个学生出去。今年大致有多少人？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;今年也起码有一百人了。因为陆陆续续有很多的中外企业参与支持，让大学生有机会去学习、实习，开阔眼界。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;除了“张骞计划”，海上丝绸之路协会还有什么样的工作思考？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;我们开展了很多论坛，包括不同的国家以及东南亚国家的论坛。我们的目的，是希望扩大朋友圈。 ;

;

;;“;;软力量”推动中国文化;

;

;;南方周末：;;如今，湾区的融合互动越来越大，作为海上丝绸之路的协会主席，你有什么相关的计划和设想？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;李特首已经举行了上任以后第一次的粤港研习会议，其中加强科技、金融，人才的交流，文化的加强和交流也非常重要。澳门是海上丝绸之路的一部分，我们也想跟澳门加强合作。同时，希望将来安排多点学生去大湾区学习考察、加深他们对岭南文化的理解。 ;

;

;;南方周末：;;现在香港学生对海上丝绸之路的文化，包括中国传统文化的熟悉程度和理解，达到什么样的程度?;

;

;;叶刘淑仪:;;我觉得比较遗憾的，是香港的教改。 2009年推出的教改，我觉得走错了路，就好像台湾一样，把中国文化的元素大大减少。因为中史不是必修课，五万多个高考生只有五千人学习中史，学习世界史更少于五千人，学习中国文化典籍的考生只有两千人。 ;

;

;我本身是念英国人的学校，但我小时候也念过很多的典籍，包括《经史子集》都读过一点点，现在的学生大部分都没有接触过。

;

;我们安排了内地春节期间热映的《满江红》给年轻人免费观赏，但是他们不知道故事是发生在什么样的历史背景下，反响也一般。所以我觉得是教育出了问题，但现在已经加强中国历史典籍的教育传授，加强中史以及国情教育的传授，这些具有非常重要的意义。

;

;;“香港未来的前途跟中国密不可分”;

;

;;南方周末：;;作为汇贤智库的负责人，也是海上丝绸之路协会的负责人，同时还是立法委员，也曾担任保安局局长。通过综合身份，你怎么看香港的未来？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;很多香港人都不明白，但也越来越多人在明白、觉醒。其实二十多年前，香港还没有回归祖国时，新加坡总理李光耀来香港考察时说，“香港未来的前途跟中国密不可分。”;

;

;确实，香港跟国家是风雨同路的。所以我们也很感谢国家不断地支持香港，香港今天稳定安全的局面得来不易。

;

;不过，虽然《国安法》平息了2019年的骚乱，但是仍然有一些敌对的势力在香港蠢蠢欲动，所以还需要提高警惕。香港还没有为《基本法23条》立法，而澳门已经在2009年完成了这项工作。所以李特首已经表态，这是一个非常重要且需要优先的工作。

;

;;南方周末：;;你怎么看待香港的危机和机遇?;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;中国有五千多年历史，国家有非常古老的一面，也有非常现代先进的一面。比如有部电影《流浪地球》，就充分地表现了中国在科技方面的发展，包括航天方面的不凡成就。 ;

;

;我们要向香港年轻人多介绍中国各方面的成就。现在香港有故宫文化博物馆，是一个非常重要的传播载体。另外，香港也举办了如“三星堆”展览，我希望将来能有多一点中国现代化方面的成就在香港展示。

;

;其实内地文化软力量很厉害。现在很多年轻人包括一些在外国留学的年轻人，也非常喜欢看内地的电视剧，内地的偶像顶流在香港也有市场，而且他们的水平很高。比较现代化的街舞等表演在香港很受年轻人的欢迎，我也希望香港的文化表演团体，能有机会到内地演出。

;

;我听说今年过春节时，有一部非常卖座的电影《毒舌律师》是律政片，在内地很受欢迎，所以期待将来香港与内地能在文化方面多点交流。香港是个中西文化交流的中心，我希望未来在这方面，无论是新民党、海上丝绸之路协会，都能为此多做一点贡献。

;

;;“超级联系人”;

;

;;南方周末：;;新民党的主要成员基本上是精英阶层，而且是中产阶级偏上。作为新民党主席，你怎么看待新民党的作用？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;新民党于2011年1月9日在香港正式举行成立典礼，当时只有我一位议员。但在2021年的大选中，我们赢了3个议席，又在2022年的补选中多赢了一个议席。所以新民党现在已经有6位立法会议员，1位区议员。 ;

;

;不同的政党都有不同的代表性。当年创党，是因为我觉得香港有一大部分的市民如中产阶级的市民、在国外接受教育的市民，以及思想比较西化的市民，他们都很爱国爱港，但没有党派为他们发声。所以新民党吸纳这些人员，教育水平也都比较高。

;

;我跟黎栋国（前保安局局长）是前官，所以我俩有很多公务员支持，包括纪律部队；容海恩议员是一位大律师；李梓敬在美国受过高等教育；陈家珮由地区直选。 2022年补选的、赢得一席的何敬康是澳门原特首何厚铧先生的侄儿，他可以协助我们加强跟澳门的联系，而且他也是留英留美的，非常理解西方的文化价值，有助香港发挥“中介人”“超级联络人”的作用。

;

;;南方周末：;;香港特区政府成立以后，你是首位女性保安局局长，现任特首李家超也是保安局局长出身。你们之间有没有怎样的交流与合作？ ;

;

;;叶刘淑仪：;;我跟李家超特首的交往很有趣。我当香港保安局局长时，李家超是有组织及严重罪案调查科的主管，当时他的外号就是“神探”，因为其心思非常缜密。 ;

;

;无论他当保安局局长还是当特首，我也跟他合作得很好。

;

;在立法会发言前，我会询问李家超一些材料，形成工作默契，为现在的工作配合打下基础。

;

;李特首有一个非常好的本领，他很愿意夸奖他的下属。工作表现好的时候，很愿意表扬他们，肯定其贡献。而且他能团结公务员、议员、行政会议成员。所以李特首上任之后，我们的氛围很好。我觉得2023 年真的是香港随着国家经济复苏，值得拼搏的一年。

;

; Wed, 18 Oct 2023 11:25:04 +0800 国内首部放生法规将生效：科学放生才是行善丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/258752
;;2023-10-18 10:00:00;
;

;国内第一部专门规范野生动物放生的地方性法规《广州市野生动物放生管理规定》，将自2023年11月1日起实施。

;

;放生，在佛道两教中都是“善行”。佛教《梵网经》有言，“佛子应以慈心行放生之业……若见世人杀畜生时，应方便救护，解其苦难。”道教经典中也有《放生文》《杀生七戒》等劝人不杀生、放生的经文。中国佛道两教信徒众多，因此放生的事近年来也越来越多。但是，不科学的盲目放生，不仅不能给被放生的动物带来好处，还有可能造成生态灾难，有必要对放生活动进行规范。

;

;广州市人大制定的放生管理规定，首先规定禁止放生所有的外来物种，并列举了鳄雀鳝、豹纹翼甲鲶（即俗称的“清道夫鱼”）、齐氏罗非鱼、淡水白鲳、食蚊鱼、埃及塘鲺、泰国鲮鱼、大鳄龟、红耳彩龟（俗称巴西龟）、美洲牛蛙等重点物种。

;

;放生这些外来野生动物，可能给本土生物带来严重的威胁。比如鳄雀鳝，这是一种凶猛的肉食鱼类，成体体型巨大，最大可达3米，号称一条就能吃掉一片湖里所有的鱼，甚至会咬人。鳄雀鳝原产于北美洲南部，但近年来国内不少地方都出现了它的身影。这种鱼在国内水域中几乎没有天敌，一旦在野外泛滥，后果不堪设想。河南汝州中央公园曾经排干了20万立方米的湖水，就为了捕捉一条鳄雀鳝。罗非鱼、清道夫等外来物种，也会严重挤压本土生物的生存空间。

;

;放生了一种动物，却给另外的动物甚至整个生态带来灾难，恐怕也不是“善”。事实上，擅自放生外来物种，已经被明确规定为违法甚至犯罪行为。 2021年4月15日生效的“生物安全法”规定，未经批准，擅自释放或者丢弃外来物种的，责令限期捕回、找回释放或者丢弃的外来物种，处一万元以上五万元以下的罚款。 2021年3月1日起生效的刑法修正案（十一）规定，非法引进、释放或者丢弃外来入侵物种，情节严重的，处三年以下有期徒刑或者拘役，并处或者单处罚金。

;

;而有些物种，虽然不是从境外来的，但是放生到不合适的地点，也可能适得其反。中国幅员辽阔，很多地方有自己独特的生态系统。某个地方的本土物种，到了其他地方，可能无法适应环境而死亡。比如适合在温暖水域生活的鱼类，到了北方的冬天就会被冻死。盲目放生，把动物放生到不适合其生存的环境中，这些动物不仅不能“生”，反而会加速死亡。甚至有些人把淡水鱼类拿到大海去放生，这不是放生，而是杀生。大批被放生的动物死亡，也会造成环境污染。

;

;还有一种可能，就是一地的本土物种，到了另一地，可能成了“入侵物种”，破坏当地原生生态。这种来自境内其他生态系统的物种，对本土生态来说，本质上也是外来入侵物种。

;

;因此，广州放生管理规定要求，放生要选择适合放生地野外生存的野生动物，并严格控制放生数量，不得对生态系统造成危害。法规还要求管理部门制定公布适合放生的本土野生动物名录，公众可从名录中选择放生的物种。

;

;除了物种的选择，放生地也很重要。不合适的放生地点，除了被放生的动物可能无法生存之外，还可能给人类带来危险，比如在靠近人类活动的区域放生凶猛有毒的动物。曾经有人在公园放生毒蛇、鳄鱼，在海滩放生电鳐、海鳗等，都严重威胁到游客的人身安全。为此，广州放生管理规定要求管理部门划定并公布适合放生的区域，禁止在放生区域以外的地方放生。

;

;法规还规定了违法放生的后果。放生野生动物外来物种的，按照野生动物保护法的规定处罚；在放生区域以外的其他地方放生的，处二千元以上一万元以下罚款；对生态环境可能造成损害的，责令限期捕回，已经造成损害的，并处一万元以上十万元以下罚款。

;

;放生，在宗教观念中是“善”。但盲目放生却未必是好事，甚至可能对被放生的动物本身、对其他生物和生态环境、对人带来严重的危害，那就不是行善，而是作恶了。对放生进行规范，很有必要。应加强宣传，普及科学放生知识，更要加大执法力度，对违法放生行为加以处罚，避免盲目放生造成严重损害。

;Recently, more patients with Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection have appeared in hospitals across the country, mostly children.

;

;What is mycoplasma? At what age is it easy for a child to get it? Can adults get it too? Let me reveal the secrets of Mycoplasma pneumoniae one by one!

;

;;;

;;01;;What is Mycoplasma pneumoniae? ;

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae is the smallest microorganism known in the world that can survive independently, between bacteria and viruses. Mycoplasma pneumoniae has no cell wall structure, like bacteria without a "coat". Both 75% alcohol and chlorine-containing disinfectant (such as 84 disinfectant) can kill Mycoplasma pneumoniae.

;

;;;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae is an important pathogen of acute respiratory infections in Beijing. Mycoplasma pneumoniae is divided into two subtypes, type I and type II. Currently, type I is the main prevalent subtype in Beijing.

;

;The population is generally susceptible to Mycoplasma pneumoniae, but it is more common in children and adolescents over 5 years old.

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection can occur throughout the year. The high incidence period of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection in Beijing is from August to December every year, and usually reaches its peak around November every year.

;

;;02;;How is Mycoplasma pneumoniae spread? ;

;

;Patients with Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection and asymptomatic infections are the main sources of infection. The incubation period is 1 to 3 weeks, and they are infectious during the incubation period until symptoms subside for several weeks.

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae is mainly transmitted through droplets, and the pathogen can be carried in secretions during coughing, sneezing, and runny noses.

;

;;03;;What are the symptoms of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection? ;

;

;The main symptoms of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection are fever and cough. Generally, the cough is severe, and the cough may continue for 1-2 weeks after the fever subsides.

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection can cause upper respiratory tract infections, lower respiratory tract infections such as pneumonia, and extrapulmonary complications, such as autoimmune hemolytic anemia.

;

;Mycoplasma pneumoniae is one of the main pathogens causing the high incidence of pneumonia in autumn and winter in Beijing. Mycoplasma pneumoniae pneumonia is generally an interstitial pneumonia, so the clinical signs are often lighter than the imaging examination results, and after the clinical symptoms disappear, lung imaging examinations may still show inflammation.

;

;Since Mycoplasma pneumoniae does not have a cell wall, the familiar penicillins and cephalosporins, which are antibiotics that target the cell wall, are completely ineffective against Mycoplasma pneumoniae.

;

;Macrolide antibiotics, such as roxithromycin and azithromycin, are currently the first-choice treatments for Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection.

;

;Therefore, if citizens have fever accompanied by severe cough, they should seek medical treatment in time, identify the cause as soon as possible, standardize treatment, and avoid blindly taking medication on their own.

;

;;04;;How to prevent Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection? ;

;

;There is currently no vaccine to prevent Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection. The most important thing to prevent Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection is to develop good personal hygiene habits.

;

;1. Try to avoid going to public places with dense crowds and poor ventilation, and wear a mask to protect yourself when necessary.

;

;2. Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing, or cover it with your elbow or upper sleeve, and throw the used tissue into a covered trash can.

;

;3. Pay attention to hand hygiene, use soap and hand sanitizer to wash hands under running water. If there is no running water, you can use alcohol-based hand sanitizer to wipe and disinfect your hands;. ;

;

;;

;

;;4. During the high epidemic season;, pay attention to indoor ventilation and ventilate for no less than 30 minutes each time to keep the air fresh.

;

;5. Develop healthy living habits, exercise moderately, increase body resistance, and keep warm to avoid catching cold.

;

;6. Schools, kindergartens and other key places should pay attention to ventilation and disinfection, do daily cleaning work, and strengthen health monitoring to avoid clusters of infectious ; infections. ;

;;On October 15, local time, the official website of the University of Pennsylvania announced that the school will open on May 18 next year At the graduation ceremony of the Weizman School of Design, Lin Huiyin, a graduate of the school and a pioneer in Chinese architecture, was awarded a belated Bachelor of Architecture degree to express her commemoration and recognition. ;

;

;In the exhibition "Building in China: A Century of Dialogues on Modern Architecture" currently on display at the Penn Wharton China Center in Beijing, a long The 15-foot display board is eye-catching. It shows 23 Chinese graduates who studied architecture at the University of Pennsylvania between 1918 and 1941. After returning to China, these students became pioneers in opening up China's construction industry and architectural education, and devoted themselves to building China's rapidly developing cities and towns. , so he is known as the "first generation of Chinese modern architects". At the center of the panel is Lin Huiyin, the only female among these students, and the only one who was not awarded a degree in architecture from Penn.

;

;According to the chief curator of the exhibition, Professor Lin Zhongjie from the Department of Urban and Regional Planning at the Weitzman School of Design at the University of Pennsylvania, Lin Huiyin and Liang Sicheng entered the University of Pennsylvania in the fall of 1924. At that time, they both wanted to pursue a degree in architecture. However, at that time, due to the fact that the required art courses including male model sketching and construction courses teaching construction techniques were not suitable for girls, the Department of Architecture at the University of Pennsylvania did not recruit girls, so Lin Huiyin had to register in the Art Department. However, she not only took all the architectural design courses, studied design theory, painting and architectural history, but also served as a teaching assistant in architectural design. Her academic performance was better than that of most of her male classmates. On her transcript, many classes received "Excellence" ( Distinguished) rating.

;

;After returning to China, Lin Huiyin and Liang Sicheng worked together and made great contributions to reshaping China's architectural history, education and practice. “When you come to the United States, everyone knows Frank Lloyd Wright. And when you go to China, everyone knows Lin Huiyin and Liang Sicheng.” Weizman School of Design City and Region said Genie Birch, professor of urban studies and education in the Department of Planning.

;

;In 1934, the University of Pennsylvania’s architecture major began to admit female students. Since then, the School of Fine Arts (the original name of the Weitzman School of Design in the 20th century) has awarded supplementary architecture degrees to women who had previously studied architecture at Penn, including Georgiana Pope, the first female director of the Philadelphia Department of City Building. Georgiana Pope Yeatman. But Lin Huiyin's case has been ignored, even though she completed more architecture courses than any other female student of her time.

;

;"Judging from records at the time, it is clear that Lin Huiyin wanted to study architecture and become an architect, and she later achieved great success in this field." Dean of the Weizman School of Design Fritz Steiner, Paley Chair Professor, initiated an investigation and review process into Lin Huiyin’s degree starting in 2022. “As our research continues to deepen, it becomes clear why she was not awarded a degree. Her identity as a woman. This is a historical mistake and it’s time to correct it."

;

;;

;

;After learning that the University of Pennsylvania decided to posthumously award Lin Huiyin a degree, her family expressed their pride, gratitude and joy. Feeling. "For my mother to be recognized by the school a hundred years later, it reminds me of her bravery and determination in choosing this major. She identified architecture as a teenager and determined to become a new generation of female architects. She enthusiastically guided and encouraged her father Liang Sicheng fell in love with her and chose architecture together. From then on, she was loyal to her choice throughout her life and sacrificed everything for her choice." Lin Huiyin's daughter Liang Zaibing said with emotion that today, on Lin Huiyin's tombstone, her husband Liang Sicheng inscribed "Architect Lin Huiyin" can be said to be a high-level summary of her life. "As her descendants, we admire and appreciate her fearless spirit in pursuing her artistic dreams." Lin Huiyin's granddaughter Yu Kui said that the University of Pennsylvania chose to honor Lin Huiyin on the occasion of the 120th anniversary of her birth and the 100th anniversary of her enrollment. Teaching a degree in architecture will inject more hope and strength into the pursuit of dreams for future generations, especially women.

;"The President's Billionaire Imprisoned Wife", "The Heaven-defying Princess Leaves Too Wild", "Son-in-law Dominates the World" and "Security "The President's Daughter and Little Beloved Wife"... If you come across micro-short dramas like this on short video platforms or other social platforms, don't be surprised. These micro-short dramas are becoming a creative craze, with people complaining about tyrants. Young people who always follow the same old tricks quietly hide in bed at night and start practicing.

;

;"Detawen's Micro Short Drama Market Report for the First Half of 2023" shows that a total of 481 new micro short dramas were released in the first half of 2023, compared with only 454 new ones in the whole year of 2022. This year The number of micro-short dramas in the first half of the year has exceeded that of the whole of last year. In July alone, 361 online micro-short dramas were recorded and announced.

;

;On the one hand, micro-short dramas are becoming a creative trend, on the other hand, the roughness and vulgarity of micro-short dramas are also despised by many netizens - why are micro-short dramas so popular? Is the only way for micro-short dramas to break out of the circle is the "three vulgarities"?

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;Short, flat, fast;

;

;Compared with previous long dramas or short dramas, the difference between micro-short dramas is the length. Each episode can be up to ten minutes, and the shortest can even be only A few dozen seconds is in sharp contrast to the average length of a long drama episode of 40 minutes. In the past two years, the creation of micro-short dramas has become a trend, mainly due to the "short, flat, and fast" nature of its creation form.

;

; "Short" means that the duration of micro-short dramas is very short, the shooting threshold is very low, and the shooting techniques are much simpler. It can be said that as long as you have a mobile phone and a story outline, you can shoot a short drama. A short drama.

;

;Assuming 20 episodes, each episode is 1 minute, a short drama is only 20 minutes long, which is less than the length of one episode of a long drama. With such a low threshold for creation, everyone can enter. Various small film and television production companies have used micro-short plays as the starting point for creation, easily triggering a creative boom.

;

;"Plain", micro-short dramas are generally not so particular in film and television arts, and can be plain and mediocre. This is because micro-short dramas are parasitic on short video platforms. They are not meant to be viewed on large screens such as TVs, and mobile phone screens have limited capacity.

;

;Especially for micro-short plays with a vertical screen, if you take a close-up shot and see the expressions of the characters clearly, you can probably only accommodate two characters. It is difficult to pay attention to the depth of field and the depth of field. Space layout and shot scheduling. Therefore, many micro-short dramas are just about filming the characters and the plot, and they are all about saving money on the art and scenery, the service, etc.

;

;"Fast" means that the filming time of micro-short dramas is very fast, the broadcast cycle is very fast, and more importantly, the money comes in very quickly. The cost of many micro-short dramas is only a few thousand or tens of thousands of yuan. You can shoot one in three to five days. After shooting one, you can directly launch a short video or small program. If it becomes popular, you can copy another one in ten days. It's a good money, you can quickly get a lot of traffic.

;

;There are many ways to make money from micro-short dramas. Although micro-short dramas with an episode length of one or two minutes are not available on long-form video platforms such as "Youai Tengmang", they are very popular on short-video platforms. After micro-short dramas become popular, the protagonists of micro-short dramas can transform into Internet celebrities and carry out live broadcasts to promote products; some micro-short dramas are customized by advertisers, and the entire episode revolves around the advertising brand.

;

;Those micro-short dramas that are parasitic on small programs can also be watched on a paid basis. A drama usually has more than 100 episodes, and each episode is one minute. The first part can be watched for free, but the subsequent episodes require payment. Unlocked viewing, watching a mini-series is even more expensive than watching a movie.

;

;The creative threshold is very low, the creative techniques are simple, the shooting time is short, and the money comes in quickly... It is not surprising that micro-short dramas have become a new trend.

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;Vulgar, vulgar, kitsch;

;

;However, it is worth noting that on the one hand, micro-short dramas are very popular, and on the other hand, micro-short dramas have been criticized and criticized by many people. The root cause is that a large part of micro-short dramas on the market have strong "three vulgarities" characteristics: vulgarity, vulgarity, and kitsch.

;

;Swarmed are all micro-short dramas. There are too many content for the audience to choose from. If you don’t find it interesting, just flick it by in three or two seconds, and the micro-short dramas will not get traffic.

;

;In order to catch the attention of users at the first glance, the orientation of many micro-short dramas can only be very "vulgar". As some netizens summarized, they are nothing more than "The Domineering President Falls in Love with Me, The Hero" Saving an American but being rescued, falling in love while playing hard to get, seeing the true love in a kidnapping case"... It's just a "picking up", "picking up a boss as a girlfriend", "picking up a boss as a boyfriend", "picking up a boss as a husband", "accidentally picking up a boss" Contents such as “Get a CEO Husband” are flying all over the place.

;

;Some micro-short dramas have further slipped into "vulgarity" and made a big fuss over the edges. In particular, some micro-short dramas in mini programs have not obtained online registration numbers. The content is very large, full of sexual innuendo, or has bloody and violent scenes. Moreover, because the broadcast channel is very hidden, it has repeatedly escaped supervision, which is quite bad.

;

;Whether it is vulgar or vulgar, it is all about pleasing and flattering the audience. It not only caters to the instinctive parts of human nature, but also tries its best to tease users' emotions and create traffic by selling emotions.

;

;This emotion is composed of "hate" and "pleasure" - many micro-short dramas remind us of Mi Meng in the public account era - interestingly, after the transformation, Mi Meng has also become a micro-short drama The manipulator behind the show: The targets of the micro-short drama are "bitches, low bitches, scumbags, scumbags, and vicious female supporting characters." These "enemies" combine all kinds of personality flaws that the audience is tired of. The method maximizes the various flaws of the "enemy" to arouse the audience's hatred, and then humiliates, criticizes and attacks these villains through the protagonist's counterattack, allowing the audience to gain a sense of emotional catharsis.

;

;However, the "hate" and "happiness" brought about by this kind of kitsch simplify human nature, breed intolerance between people, intensify estrangement, and have a subtle influence on social mentality. negative impact.

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;The possibility of being "micro" but not "vulgar";

;

;The recklessness of micro-short dramas has attracted official attention.

;

;Especially in May this year, the State Administration of Radio, Film and Television issued new rules for the broadcasting of online dramas. After June 1, 2023, online dramas, online mini-series, online movies, and online cartoons that have been planned and registered will be Adopt a management approach with full license coverage. Only broadcasts can be broadcast after obtaining the "Online Drama Distribution License" in accordance with the law. Those without a license are not allowed to be broadcast; for those that have previously passed the planning and filing, licenses or numbers will be issued based on the circumstances.

;

;Furthermore, starting from June 1, 2023, newly launched online dramas, online micro-shorts, online movies, and online cartoons must be declared through the "Key Online Film and Television Drama Information Filing System" , and works that have obtained the "Online Drama Distribution License" or online registration number after passing the content review of the radio and television management department at or above the provincial level.

;

;Before this, there was a brief regulatory blank period for micro-short dramas. That is, many micro-short dramas were filmed and released casually. Take whatever you can to catch people's attention. Some short dramas on mini programs have become a place for "harboring evil and evil people and practices".

;

;After the new regulations are released, the creation and broadcast of micro-short dramas will also face strict review. Only those that pass the review can be broadcast online on the platform. This also means that it is difficult to follow the "three customs" path of micro-short dramas.

;

;Micro short plays can only be "micro" but not "vulgar".

;

;On the one hand, micro-short dramas can also be "high-quality". For example, "Youai Tengmang" is also entering the micro-short drama industry. Each episode of the micro-short dramas they produce is only ten minutes long, and they use regular techniques for filming film and television dramas to shoot micro-short dramas. This makes micro-short dramas have A certain aesthetic style makes it more meaningful.

;

;For example, in this year's popular "Invitation", director Zeng Qingjie's camera language is very sophisticated, and he shoots a story in a pure and beautiful way. It has the simplicity of a short play and the texture of a long drama. The box office is divided into two. More than 16 million yuan.

;

;On the other hand, for those micro-short dramas with a single episode of only tens of seconds or two or three minutes, the production team does not have the money to pay attention to quality, so they have to make a fuss about the theme expression.

;

;既然不能“俗”，那么就要另辟蹊径，要么就把“爽感”发挥得更极致，要么就通过创意让观众耳目一新。 Otherwise, the micro-short drama will either end up being filmed but not broadcast, or it will be passed over by the audience after it is broadcast. Even if the cost is not high, it will end up in the street.
